poem:
Oscars 2025  

Stars alight under troubled skies,  
a febrile night of gilded guise.  
Fires dance beyond the screen's glow,  
as Hackman's shadow tiptoes slow.  
Trump complicates the evening show,  
diversity's tale shrouded below.  
Leave it to films, in darkness seamed,  
to tell the stories we never dreamed.
